correction.p: OCR generated transcript has not been corrected.

normalization.p: Only minor normalization where needed, if any, is indicated via markup.

punctuation.p: All punctuation marks in the source text have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.
Punctuation may be marked up with pc elements for clarification, but not exclusively.

quotation.p: All quotation marks have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.

hyphenation.p: Hyphenated words that appear at the end of a line have been retained. The hyphen, if present, is represented by the Unicode code point, and marked up with a pc element. The break="no" attribute on the lb element indicates that a single word is split across the lines.

interpretation.p: Dates, places, and names may be marked up, where useful.

body.ab:
I hereby certify that I have this day united in
marriage Mr George Harrison & Miss Mary
Sands. This ceremony took place at the house
of her father Mr Jesse Sands in the town of
Hornby, County of Steuben & state of New York.
There were present on the occasion the parents
of both parties & others. Hornby Feby 19: 1835
Attest Charles Goodrich Verb. Dei Min.
A Record of our family George and Mary Harrison
Born May th.. 11 1836
William N Harrison Born June th.. 19 1837
Born March th.. 14 1839
Henry F Harrison Born May th.. 24 1840
Emma A Harrison Born May th.. 27: 1843
John Jesse Harrison Born July th.. 13: 1845
Sarah A Harrison Born January th.. 19: 1848
A Record of My family
Othiniel Sands Born January27th1733
Martha Sands Born June14th1735
Martha Sands Died April3018145
Otheniel Sands Died Jan5th1823
ChildrenJohn Sands Born October251761
Ruth Sands Born December291763
Samuel Sands Born April161766
Jesse Sands Born June71768
Martha Sands Born July61771
Nathaniel Sands Born August201773
Ruth Sands Died Augst291787
Nathaniel Sands Died Augst211777
Grandmother Harrison
died in 1895
Uncle John in 1894.
these are pieces of
wedding dresses
Mary Harrison
